info.name: Witchly App API
info.description: Comprehensive API collection for Witchly App - includes OAuth2 authentication, user login/session management with dual authentication support, GraphQL queries and mutations for user and client management with complete profile support, and advanced asset management with both simple and chunked uploads. Session operations require both OAuth2 access tokens AND user session tokens for enhanced security. Asset management supports images and videos with S3 storage, streaming uploads, progress tracking, and signed URLs for secure access.

exec: console.log('Access token saved to collection variable');

request.description: Get an OAuth2 access token using client credentials flow. Replace client_id and client_secret with actual values.
Check API health status
Basic API welcome message

item.name: üôçüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Signup (GraphQL)

request.description: Start the signup process by providing an email address. This will send a verification code to the email.

exec: console.log('Long session with refresh token saved');

request.description: Complete the signup process by providing the email and the 6-digit verification code received via email.

item.description: Signup flow endpoints - initiate with email and complete with verification code

item.name: üîë Login & Sessions (GraphQL)

request.description: Start the login process for an existing user by providing their email address. This will send a verification code to the email.

exec: console.log('Long session with refresh token saved');

request.description: Complete the login process with a verification code. Set keepMeLoggedIn to true for 90-day session with refresh token, false for 4-hour session.

exec: console.log('Session refreshed and new tokens saved');

request.description: Refresh an existing long-term session using a refresh token. Only available for sessions created with keepMeLoggedIn: true.

header.description: User session token (required for session operations)

request.description: List all active sessions for the authenticated user. Requires dual authentication: OAuth2 access token AND user session token.

header.description: User session token (required for session operations)

request.description: Logout from the current session. This will invalidate the current session token. Requires dual authentication: OAuth2 access token AND user session token.

header.description: User session token (required for session operations)

request.description: Logout from all sessions for the current user. This will invalidate all session tokens for the user. Requires dual authentication: OAuth2 access token AND user session token.

item.description: Login flow and session management endpoints - initiate login, complete with verification code, manage sessions

graphql.query:
query GetUsers($limit: Float, $offset: Float, $email: String, $name: String, $handle: String, $access: String) {
  users(limit: $limit, offset: $offset, email: $email, name: $name, handle: $handle, access: $access) {
        records {
            id
            name
            email
            handle
            allowedScopes
            emailVerified
            lastLoginAt
            createdAt
            updatedAt
            profileAsset { id, s3Key }
            bio
            shortBio
            backdropAsset  { id, s3Key }
            instagramHandle
            tikTokHandle
            twitterHandle
            websiteUrl
            facebookUrl
            snapchatHandle
            primaryColor
            sign
            sex
            location
            birthDate
            pronouns
        }
        totalCount
        limit
        offset
    }
}

request.description: Retrieve all users (public access)

graphql.query:
query GetUser($id: ID!) {
    user(id: $id) {
        id
        name
        email
        handle
        allowedScopes
        emailVerified
        lastLoginAt
        createdAt
        updatedAt
        profileAsset { id, s3Key }
        bio
        shortBio
        backdropAsset { id, s3Key }
        instagramHandle
        tikTokHandle
        twitterHandle
        websiteUrl
        facebookUrl
        snapchatHandle
        primaryColor
        sign
        sex
        location
        birthDate
        pronouns
    }
 }

request.description: Get a specific user by ID

graphql.query:
mutation CreateUser($input: CreateUserInput!) {
    createUser(input: $input) {
     id
        name
        email
        handle
        allowedScopes
        emailVerified
        lastLoginAt
        createdAt
        updatedAt
        profileAsset { id, s3Key }
        bio
        shortBio
        backdropAsset { id, s3Key }
        instagramHandle
        tikTokHandle
        twitterHandle
        websiteUrl
        facebookUrl
        snapchatHandle
        primaryColor
        sign
        sex
        location
        birthDate
        pronouns
    }  
}

request.description: Create a new user

graphql.query:
mutation UpdateUser($id: ID!, $input: UpdateUserInput!) {
    updateUser(id: $id, input: $input) {
        id
        name
        email
        handle
        allowedScopes
        emailVerified
        updatedAt
        profileAsset { id, s3Key }
        bio
        shortBio
        backdropAsset { id, s3Key }
        instagramHandle
        tikTokHandle
        twitterHandle
        websiteUrl
        facebookUrl
        snapchatHandle
        primaryColor
        sign
        sex
        location
        birthDate
        pronouns
    }
}

request.description: Update an existing user
Delete a user by ID

item.name: üîë Client Management (GraphQL)

graphql.query:
query GetClients {    
    clients {      
        id      
        clientId      
        name      
        description      
        isActive      
        allowedScopes     
        tokenExpiresIn      
        lastUsed      
        createdAt      
        updatedAt
    }
}

request.description: Get all OAuth2 clients (requires admin scope)

graphql.query:
query GetClient($clientId: String!) {    
    client(clientId: $clientId) {      
        id      
        clientId      
        name      
        description      
        isActive      
        allowedScopes      
        tokenExpiresIn      
        lastUsed      
        createdAt      
        updatedAt    
    }
}

request.description: Get a specific client by clientId (clients can view their own, admins can view any)
Create a new OAuth2 client (requires admin scope). Returns clientId and clientSecret.

graphql.query:
mutation UpdateClient($clientId: String!, $input: UpdateClientInput!) {    updateClient(clientId: $clientId, input: $input) {      
        id
        clientId
        name
        description
        isActive
        allowedScopes
        tokenExpiresIn
        updatedAt
    }
}

request.description: Update an existing OAuth2 client (requires admin scope)
Delete an OAuth2 client (requires admin scope)

graphql.query:
mutation RegenerateClientSecret($clientId: String!) {    regenerateClientSecret(clientId: $clientId)  
}

request.description: Regenerate the secret for an OAuth2 client (requires admin scope)

item.description: OAuth2 client management operations via GraphQL

item.name: üì∏ Asset Management (GraphQL + REST)

graphql.query:
query GetAssets($limit: Int, $offset: Int, $assetType: AssetTypeEnum, $signedUrl: Boolean) {
  assets(limit: $limit, offset: $offset, assetType: $assetType, signedUrl: $signedUrl) {
    assets {
      id
      fileName
      hashedFileName
      mimeType
      fileSize
      s3Key
      s3Url
      signedUrl
      publicUrl
      assetType
      uploadedBy
      createdAt
      updatedAt
    }
    total
    limit
    offset
  }
}

request.description: Get paginated list of all assets with optional filtering by type (image/video) and optional signed URLs. Requires read scope.

graphql.query:
query GetAsset($id: ID!, $signedUrl: Boolean) {
  asset(id: $id, signedUrl: $signedUrl) {
    id
    fileName
    hashedFileName
    mimeType
    fileSize
    s3Key
    s3Url
    signedUrl
    publicUrl
    assetType
    uploadedBy
    createdAt
    updatedAt
  }
}

request.description: Get a specific asset by its ID with optional signed URL generation. Requires read scope.

header.description: User session token (required for user-specific assets)

graphql.query:
query GetMyAssets($limit: Int, $offset: Int, $assetType: AssetTypeEnum, $signedUrl: Boolean) {
  myAssets(limit: $limit, offset: $offset, assetType: $assetType, signedUrl: $signedUrl) {
    assets {
      id
      fileName
      hashedFileName
      mimeType
      fileSize
      s3Key
      s3Url
      signedUrl
      assetType
      uploadedBy
      createdAt
      updatedAt
    }
    total
    limit
    offset
  }
}

request.description: Get paginated list of current user's assets. Requires dual authentication: OAuth2 read scope + user session token.
Initialize a chunked upload session for large files. Requires dual authentication: OAuth2 write scope + user session token. Returns uploadId and optimal chunkSize.

header.description: User session token (required for upload progress)

request.description: Get upload progress for a chunked upload session. Requires dual authentication: OAuth2 read scope + user session token.

header.description: User session token (required for upload cancellation)

request.description: Cancel a chunked upload session and clean up S3 resources. Requires dual authentication: OAuth2 write scope + user session token.

formdata.description: Select an image or video file to upload

request.description: Upload a single file (up to 500MB) using multipart/form-data. Streams directly to S3 for optimal performance. Requires dual authentication: OAuth2 write scope + user session token. Supports images (JPG, PNG, GIF, WebP) and videos (MP4, MOV, AVI, WebM).

header.description: SHA256 hash of the chunk data for integrity verification

request.description: Upload a single chunk for chunked upload. Requires dual authentication: OAuth2 write scope + user session token. Include X-Chunk-Hash header for integrity verification. Use after initializing chunked upload.

item.description: Complete asset management system supporting both simple and chunked uploads with GraphQL queries and REST endpoints. Features S3 integration, signed URLs, progress tracking, and dual authentication.

request.description: Get the GraphQL schema structure and available operations

item.name: üîÆ Tarot Decks (GraphQL)

request.description: Get paginated list of tarot decks filtered by status (active/paused). Requires read scope.
Get a specific tarot deck by its ID. Requires read scope.

header.description: User session token with admin scope (required)

}

request.description: Create a new tarot deck. Requires write scope AND admin session scope. All fields are optional except status.

header.description: User session token with admin scope (required)

request.description: Update an existing tarot deck. Requires write scope AND admin session scope. Only provide fields you want to update.
Soft delete a tarot deck (sets status to 'paused'). Requires write scope.
Permanently delete a tarot deck from the database. Requires write scope. Use with caution!
Get paginated list of tarot cards for a specific deck, optionally filtered by status. Requires read scope.
Get a specific tarot card by its ID. Requires read scope.

header.description: User session token with admin scope (required)

request.description: Create a new tarot card for a specific deck. Requires write scope AND admin session scope. Name and tarotDeck are required.

header.description: User session token with admin scope (required)

request.description: Update an existing tarot card. Requires write scope AND admin session scope. Only provide fields you want to update.
Soft delete a tarot card (sets status to 'paused'). Requires write scope.
Permanently delete a tarot card from the database. Requires write scope. Use with caution!

item.description: Complete CRUD operations for tarot deck and tarot card management. Create/Update operations require admin session scope.

item.name: üåô Covens

graphql.query:
mutation CreateCoven($input: CreateCovenInput!) {
  createCoven(input: $input) {
    success
    message
    coven {
      id
      name
      description
      privacy
      status
      tradition
      structure
      practice
      maxMembers
      primaryColor
      secondaryColor
      webUrl
      webUrlLabel
      font
      locale
      user {
        id
        handle
      }
      createdAt
      updatedAt
    }
  }
}

        "webUrl": "http://test.com",

    "locale": "en-US"
  }
}

request.description: Update coven details. Only owner or admin can update. Requires write scope.
Soft delete coven (sets status to 'deleted'). Only owner or admin. Requires write scope.
Permanently delete coven and all roster entries. Only owner or admin. Requires admin scope.
Join a coven with basic role. Checks maxMembers limit and prevents duplicates. Requires write scope.
Leave a coven. Owners cannot leave. Requires write scope.
Get single coven by ID. Requires read scope.
Get covens with optional filters (tradition, structure, practice, privacy, userId). Pagination 1-100. Requires read scope.
Get covens current user is a member of. Requires read scope.
Get coven roster/members. Pagination 1-100. Requires read scope.
Update roster entry. Role-based permissions: admin/owner can change roles, co-owner can update basic/editor, users can update own profile. Requires write scope.

item.description: Coven management: create, join, manage covens and roster. Supports traditions, structures, privacy levels, and member roles (owner/co-owner/editor/basic).

item.name: üí¨ Chat

request.description: Create chat message. Max 5000 chars. Can be linked to coven/global/private entities. Requires write scope.
Update chat message. Only owner or admin can update. Requires write scope.
Delete chat message (hard delete). Only owner or admin. Requires write scope.
Toggle like on chat message (add/remove). Requires write scope.
Toggle emoji reaction on chat message (add/remove). Use Unicode format (U+1F31D). Requires write scope.
Get chat messages by entity (coven/global/private). Sorted by createdAt DESC. Pagination 1-100. Requires read scope.

item.description: Chat messaging system with likes and emoji reactions. Supports entity-based contexts (coven/global/private). Unicode emoji format (U+XXXXX).

request.description: Update event. Only owner or admin. Validates dates if both provided. Requires write scope.
Delete event (hard delete). Only owner or admin. Requires write scope.
Toggle RSVP to event (add/remove). Auto-removes from interested when RSVPing. Requires write scope.
Toggle interested status (add/remove). Doesn't affect RSVP. Requires write scope.
Get events by entity (coven/global/private). Optional date range filters. Pagination 1-100. Requires read scope.
Get events filtered by date range. Pass dates as ISO strings inline. Requires read scope.
Get events where user is creator, RSVP'd, or interested. Optional date filters. Requires read scope.

graphql.query:
query GetEventsByUser($userId: ID!, $limit: Int, $offset: Int) {
  eventsByUser(userId: $userId, limit: $limit, offset: $offset) {
    id
    name
    description
    startDateTime
    endDateTime
    entityId
    entityType
    rsvpUsers
    interestedUsers
    createdAt
  }
}

request.description: Get events created by specific user. Optional date filters. Requires read scope.

item.description: Event calendar with RSVP/interested tracking, timezone support, and date range queries. Supports entity-based contexts (coven/global/private).

graphql.variables:
{
  "input": {

request.description: Create a new market product (admin only). Requires admin user session and write scope.
Update an existing market product (admin only). Requires admin user session and write scope.
Soft delete a market product by setting status to 'deleted' (admin only). Requires admin user session and write scope.
Permanently delete a market product from database (admin only). Requires admin user session and write scope.
Toggle like on a market product. If already liked, removes like; if not liked, adds like. Requires user session and write scope.
Get market products with filters. Non-admin users only see active products. Admin users can filter by status. Supports pagination, category filtering, and locale. Requires read scope.
